title: Complete React.js Masterclass
description: Go from zero to hero with React. Learn hooks, state management, router, and build real-world applications in this comprehensive guide.

lessons.title: Introduction to React & JSX
lessons.content: Welcome! In this lesson, we explore why React is so popular. We will set up our environment using Vite and write our first line of JSX. You'll learn how JSX differs from HTML.

lessons.title: Components and Props
lessons.content: React is built on components. Learn how to create functional components and pass dynamic data between them using Props to make your UI reusable.

lessons.title: State Management with useState
lessons.content: State is the memory of your component. We dive deep into the useState hook to handle user input, toggles, and counters.

lessons.title: Handling Side Effects with useEffect
lessons.content: Learn how to fetch data from APIs and interact with the browser DOM outside of the React render cycle using the useEffect hook.

lessons.title: React Router Dom Basics
lessons.content: Single Page Applications need navigation. We will implement client-side routing to switch between pages without refreshing the browser.

lessons.title: Forms and User Input
lessons.content: Handling forms in React can be tricky. We will learn about controlled components vs uncontrolled components and how to validate inputs.

lessons.title: Context API for Global State
lessons.content: Prop drilling is annoying. Learn how to use the Context API to share state like 'User Auth' or 'Theme' across your entire application easily.

lessons.title: Custom Hooks
lessons.content: Don't repeat yourself! We will extract logic into custom hooks to make our code cleaner and more modular.

lessons.title: Performance Optimization
lessons.content: Learn about React.memo, useMemo, and useCallback to prevent unnecessary re-renders and keep your app snappy.

lessons.title: Deployment to Vercel
lessons.content: Congratulations on finishing the code! Now, let's build the production bundle and deploy our app to the web using Vercel.

title: Node.js Backend Architecture
description: Master the backend with Node.js. Learn Express, database connections, authentication, and how to structure scalable APIs.

lessons.title: The Node.js Event Loop
lessons.content: Understanding the non-blocking I/O model. We visualize the Call Stack, Node APIs, and the Event Loop queue.

lessons.title: Modules and NPM
lessons.content: Learn the difference between CommonJS and ES Modules. We also explore NPM to manage third-party packages.

lessons.title: Building a Server with Express
lessons.content: Setting up a basic HTTP server using Express.js. We cover routing, request methods (GET, POST), and status codes.

lessons.title: Middleware Functions
lessons.content: Middleware is the heart of Express. Learn how to write logging, parsing, and error-handling middleware.

lessons.title: REST API Design Standards
lessons.content: Best practices for naming routes, versioning APIs, and structuring JSON responses for a professional backend.

lessons.title: Connecting to MongoDB (Mongoose)
lessons.content: We connect our Node app to a NoSQL database. Learn schemas, models, and basic CRUD operations with Mongoose.

lessons.title: Authentication with JWT
lessons.content: Secure your API. We implement registration and login using bcrypt for password hashing and JSON Web Tokens for sessions.

lessons.title: Input Validation
lessons.content: Never trust user input. We use libraries like Zod or Joi to validate incoming data before it hits our database.

lessons.title: File Uploads with Multer
lessons.content: Learn how to handle multipart/form-data to allow users to upload profile pictures and documents to your server.

lessons.title: Unit Testing with Jest
lessons.content: Ensure your API is reliable. We write unit tests for our controllers and integration tests for our API endpoints.

title: PostgreSQL Database Design
description: Learn SQL from scratch. Design normalized schemas, write complex queries, and understand indexing for high-performance databases.

lessons.title: Relational Database Concepts
lessons.content: What is a table? What is a row? We cover primary keys, foreign keys, and the basics of relational theory.

lessons.title: Basic SQL Queries
lessons.content: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE. We practice the foundational commands to manipulate data.

lessons.title: Filtering and Sorting
lessons.content: Using WHERE clauses, ORDER BY, LIMIT, and OFFSET to find exactly the data you need.

lessons.title: Database Normalization
lessons.content: How to structure your data to avoid redundancy. We explain 1NF, 2NF, and 3NF with real-world examples.

lessons.title: Joins Mastery
lessons.content: Visualizing INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN. Connecting data across multiple tables.

lessons.title: Aggregation and Grouping
lessons.content: Using COUNT, SUM, AVG, and GROUP BY to generate reports and analytics from your raw data.

lessons.title: Indexes and Performance
lessons.content: Why is my query slow? We learn how B-Tree indexes work and when (and when not) to add them.

lessons.title: ACID Transactions
lessons.content: Ensuring data integrity. We learn about Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and Durability using BEGIN and COMMIT.

lessons.title: Stored Procedures
lessons.content: Writing functions directly in the database using PL/pgSQL to encapsulate complex logic.

lessons.title: Backups and Restoration
lessons.content: Disaster recovery. How to use pg_dump to backup your data and restore it if the server crashes.

title: UI/UX Design Fundamentals
description: Design apps that users love. Learn wireframing, color theory, typography, and how to use Figma to create stunning prototypes.

lessons.title: Introduction to Design Thinking
lessons.content: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, Test. The 5 stages of the design process explained.

lessons.title: Wireframing vs Prototyping
lessons.content: Low fidelity sketches vs High fidelity interactive mockups. When to use which.

lessons.title: Figma Crash Course
lessons.content: Getting around the interface. Frames, layers, vectors, and the pen tool basics.

lessons.title: Color Theory & Psychology
lessons.content: Choosing a palette. Understanding complementary colors, contrast ratios, and emotional impact.

lessons.title: Typography Rules
lessons.content: Serif vs Sans Serif. Line height, kerning, and hierarchy. How to make text readable.

lessons.title: Spacing and Grids
lessons.content: Using the 8pt grid system. Understanding negative space (whitespace) to let your design breathe.

lessons.title: Component Libraries
lessons.content: Creating reusable buttons, inputs, and cards in Figma using Auto Layout and Variants.

lessons.title: User Research Methods
lessons.content: How to conduct user interviews, create personas, and map out user journeys.

lessons.title: Accessibility (a11y)
lessons.content: Designing for everyone. Color blindness simulation, screen reader considerations, and WCAG guidelines.

lessons.title: Developer Handoff
lessons.content: How to prepare your design file for engineers so they can code it pixel-perfectly.

title: DevOps with Docker & Kubernetes
description: Stop saying 'it works on my machine'. Containerize your apps and orchestrate them for massive scale.

lessons.title: Virtual Machines vs Containers
lessons.content: Why Docker changed the world. Understanding the OS kernel, images, and containers.

lessons.title: Writing a Dockerfile
lessons.content: Containerizing a Node.js app. FROM, WORKDIR, COPY, RUN, and CMD commands explained.

lessons.title: Docker Compose
lessons.content: Orchestrating multi-container environments (App + Database) locally with a single YAML file.

lessons.title: Docker Networking
lessons.content: How containers talk to each other. Bridge networks, host networks, and port mapping.

lessons.title: Intro to Kubernetes (K8s)
lessons.content: Moving from one server to a cluster. The architecture of the Control Plane and Worker Nodes.

lessons.title: Pods and Services
lessons.content: The atomic unit of K8s. Deploying a Pod and exposing it to the internet via a Service.

lessons.title: ReplicaSets and Deployments
lessons.content: Ensuring high availability. Self-healing, scaling replicas, and rolling updates.

lessons.title: ConfigMaps and Secrets
lessons.content: Managing environment variables and sensitive keys securely in a cluster.

lessons.title: CI/CD Pipelines
lessons.content: Automating the build and push process using GitHub Actions or GitLab CI.

lessons.title: Monitoring and Logging
lessons.content: Observability basics. Using Prometheus and Grafana to visualize cluster health.

title: Mobile Dev with React Native
description: Build native iOS and Android apps using JavaScript. Learn navigation, device features, and publishing to the App Store.

lessons.title: Expo vs CLI
lessons.content: Setting up the environment. Why we choose Expo for rapid development and when to eject.

lessons.title: Core Components
lessons.content: View, Text, Image, ScrollView. Translating HTML mental models to Native components.

lessons.title: Styling with Flexbox
lessons.content: React Native doesn't have CSS. Learn how to layout screens using the Flexbox algorithm.

lessons.title: React Navigation
lessons.content: Stack Navigator, Tab Navigator, and Drawer. Moving between screens and passing params.

lessons.title: Device APIs (Camera & Location)
lessons.content: Accessing hardware features. Asking for permissions and taking a photo.

lessons.title: Handling Lists
lessons.content: Rendering large datasets efficiently using FlatList and SectionList.

lessons.title: AsyncStorage
lessons.content: Persisting data locally on the device for offline capabilities.

lessons.title: Animations
lessons.content: Making it feel smooth. Using the Animated API and Reanimated library for gestures.

lessons.title: Push Notifications
lessons.content: Engaging users. Setting up Expo Notifications service.

lessons.title: App Store Submission
lessons.content: Generating certificates, signing the .apk/.ipa, and navigating the review process.

title: Data Structures & Algorithms
description: Crack the coding interview. Master Big O notation, trees, graphs, sorting, and dynamic programming in JavaScript.

lessons.title: Big O Notation
lessons.content: Time and Space complexity. Analyzing algorithms: O(1), O(n), O(log n), O(n^2).

lessons.title: Arrays and Strings
lessons.content: Sliding Window technique and Two Pointers. Solving common interview problems.

lessons.title: Hash Maps
lessons.content: Key-value pairs. Handling collisions and understanding O(1) lookups.

lessons.title: Linked Lists
lessons.content: Singly and Doubly linked lists. Reversing a list and detecting cycles (Floyd's algorithm).

lessons.title: Stacks and Queues
lessons.content: LIFO vs FIFO. Implementing a stack using arrays and solving bracket matching problems.

lessons.title: Trees and Traversal
lessons.content: Binary Search Trees (BST). DFS (Pre, In, Post-order) vs BFS traversal.

lessons.title: Heaps and Priority Queues
lessons.content: Min-Heap vs Max-Heap. Implementing efficient sorting and finding the Kth largest element.

lessons.title: Graphs
lessons.content: Adjacency Matrix vs List. Breadth-First Search and Depth-First Search on graphs.

lessons.title: Dynamic Programming
lessons.content: Memoization and Tabulation. Solving the Fibonacci sequence and Climbing Stairs.

lessons.title: Sorting Algorithms
lessons.content: Bubble Sort (bad) vs Merge Sort and Quick Sort (good). Divide and conquer strategies.

title: Python for Absolute Beginners
description: The perfect language to start coding. Learn syntax, automation, and data manipulation in this friendly introduction.

lessons.title: Installing Python & IDLE
lessons.content: Setting up Python 3. Running your first 'Hello World' script.

lessons.title: Variables and Data Types
lessons.content: Integers, Floats, Strings, and Booleans. Dynamic typing in Python.

lessons.title: Control Flow
lessons.content: Making decisions with If, Elif, Else. Using comparisons and logical operators.

lessons.title: Loops
lessons.content: For loops and While loops. Iterating over ranges and lists.

lessons.title: Functions
lessons.content: Defining functions with `def`. Arguments, return values, and scope.

lessons.title: Lists and Dictionaries
lessons.content: Working with collections. Slicing lists and accessing dictionary keys.

lessons.title: Object Oriented Programming (OOP)
lessons.content: Classes and Objects. `__init__`, methods, and inheritance basics.

lessons.title: Modules and PIP
lessons.content: Importing standard libraries (`math`, `random`) and installing external packages.

lessons.title: File I/O
lessons.content: Reading from and writing to text files and CSVs using `open()`.

lessons.title: Error Handling
lessons.content: Try, Except, Finally blocks. Preventing your program from crashing.

title: Machine Learning Basics
description: An intro to AI. Learn about regression, classification, neural networks, and how to use Scikit-Learn.

lessons.title: AI vs ML vs Deep Learning
lessons.content: Demystifying the buzzwords. What is the difference and history of the field?

lessons.title: Supervised vs Unsupervised
lessons.content: Labeled vs Unlabeled data. Classification vs Clustering problems.

lessons.title: Pandas for Data Analysis
lessons.content: Dataframes and Series. Cleaning data and handling missing values.

lessons.title: Linear Regression
lessons.content: Predicting a number. Fitting a line to data points. Mean Squared Error.

lessons.title: Logistic Regression
lessons.content: Predicting a category (Yes/No). The Sigmoid function and probability.

lessons.title: Decision Trees
lessons.content: Visualizing decisions. Entropy and Information Gain. Random Forests.

lessons.title: Model Evaluation
lessons.content: Train/Test split. Confusion Matrix, Accuracy, Precision, and Recall.

lessons.title: K-Means Clustering
lessons.content: Grouping similar data points together without labels.

lessons.title: Intro to Neural Networks
lessons.content: Neurons, Weights, Biases. The concept of the Perceptron.

lessons.title: Building a Model with Scikit-Learn
lessons.content: Putting it all together. Loading a dataset, training a model, and making predictions.

title: Digital Marketing Strategy
description: Grow your business online. Master SEO, Social Media, Content Marketing, and Analytics.

lessons.title: The Marketing Funnel
lessons.content: Awareness, Interest, Desire, Action. Mapping the customer journey.

lessons.title: SEO Fundamentals
lessons.content: On-page vs Off-page SEO. Keywords, meta tags, and backlinks.

lessons.title: Content Marketing
lessons.content: Blogging and Video. Creating value to attract an audience.

lessons.title: Social Media Strategy
lessons.content: Choosing the right platform. Instagram vs LinkedIn vs TikTok strategies.

lessons.title: Email Marketing
lessons.content: Building a list. Segmentation, automation, and writing high-converting subject lines.

lessons.title: PPC Advertising (Google Ads)
lessons.content: Pay Per Click basics. Bidding strategies, quality score, and ad copy.

lessons.title: Facebook & Instagram Ads
lessons.content: Targeting audiences. Custom audiences, lookalikes, and pixel tracking.

lessons.title: Google Analytics 4
lessons.content: Measuring success. Users, Sessions, Bounce Rate, and Conversion tracking.

lessons.title: Branding and Identity
lessons.content: Voice, Tone, and Visuals. Consistency across channels.

lessons.title: Growth Hacking
lessons.content: Creative, low-cost strategies to acquire users rapidly.
